title: Instagram update introduces support for iOS 13 dark mode
text:
CLOSE

A screenshot of the Instagram app in dark mode. (Photo: Instagram)

Social media app Instagram is not afraid of the dark.

An update of the app just released for iPhones introduces support for dark mode on both iOS 13 and Android 10.

When users flip their iPhones into dark mode, for example, Instagram automatically converts into a gorgeous display featuring a black background.

Adam Mosseri, the head of Instagram, confirmed the update in a post on his Twitter account Monday night.

"Starting today, you can use Instagram in dark mode on iOS 13 or Android 10," Mosseri wrote Monday night.

Other social media apps such as Twitter and Facebook Messenger already offer the option to use a dark mode. However, the primary Facebook app has yet to introduce a similar feature.

Starting today, you can use Instagram in dark mode on iOS 13 or Android 10. Turn dark mode on your phone to try it out. 👀 — Adam Mosseri (@mosseri) October 8, 2019

Oh hello official dark mode for Instagram! 😍 pic.twitter.com/IEGDldljRa — Raymond Wong📱💾📼 (@raywongy) October 8, 2019

Dark Mode was among several big features introduced by Apple when it rolled out iOS 13, the mobile operating system powering iPhones, iPads and the iPod Touch. The mode created for low-light environments allows users to set schedules to turn it on or off, and integrates with multiple third-party apps.
